nodes.title: Section IX:
nodes.prefix_summary:
##### Section IX:
Dispositions finales et abrogatoires

nodes.title: Article 10
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the procedures for publicizing an applicant's request for Congolese nationality. It specifies that public notice must be posted at local administrative offices or diplomatic missions, depending on the applicant's residence. It also mandates publication in newspapers, both within the Democratic Republic of the Congo and abroad. Finally, it establishes a three-month period following publication for any interested parties to submit observations to the judicial or administrative authorities.

nodes.title: Article 1er
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the specific supporting documents required for a foreigner's application to acquire Congolese nationality through naturalization or option. It lists 15 mandatory documents, including proof of residence, identity, language proficiency, good conduct, health, financial means, and security clearance, as well as administrative attestations and translations.

nodes.title: Article 2
nodes.summary: The partial document outlines the procedural requirements for a child born in or outside the Democratic Republic of Congo to one Congolese parent, who is applying to acquire Congolese nationality by option. It specifies that the application must be submitted in duplicate with a legalized signature and lists eleven supporting documents required. These include proof of domicile in Congo, birth certification, proof of the parent's Congolese nationality at the child's birth, documentation on nationality loss from the child's country of origin, proof of habitual residence in Congo for at least five years, proficiency in a Congolese language, certificates of good conduct and morals, a recent criminal record extract, a medical certificate, translations of foreign-language documents, and a curriculum vitae. The text also mentions that these requirements support an application for nationality acquisition through adoption.

nodes.title: Article 3
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the procedural requirements for a minor child to acquire Congolese nationality through adoption. It specifies that the application must be submitted in duplicate with a legalized signature and lists eight required supporting documents. These include proof of domicile in the DRC, a legalized birth certificate, the adoption act, proof of the adoptive parent's Congolese nationality, a certificate on loss of original nationality, proof of proficiency in a Congolese language, certified French translations of foreign documents, and a curriculum vitae.

nodes.title: Article 4
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the procedural requirements for a foreigner to acquire Congolese nationality through option, specifically when one adoptive parent has voluntarily acquired or regained Congolese nationality. It lists the supporting documents that must accompany the declaration, including proof of residence, birth records, adoption documents, proof of the adoptive parent's nationality at the time of birth, evidence of language proficiency, certificates of good conduct and health, and various legalized translations and administrative records.

nodes.title: Section V: Des documents � produire � l'appui
nodes.prefix_summary: ##### Section V: Des documents � produire � l'appui

nodes.title: Article 5
nodes.summary: The partial document outlines the requirements and supporting documents for a foreign woman married to a Congolese man (or whose husband acquired Congolese nationality) to apply for Congolese nationality through marriage. It details the necessary signed and legalized declaration and lists ten specific documents, including proof of residence, birth certificate, marriage certificate proving a marriage of at least five years, certificates of good conduct and morals, a criminal record extract, medical certificates, proof of ability to speak a Congolese language, proof of the husband's Congolese nationality, and translations of foreign-language documents.

nodes.title: Article 6
nodes.summary: The partial document outlines the specific supporting documents required for a child born in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) to foreign parents to apply for Congolese nationality based on birth and residence. It references the relevant law and lists five required documents: a legalized domicile certificate, a legalized birth certificate (or substitute), proof of permanent residence in the DRC, a notarized written declaration of intent to acquire Congolese nationality, and French translations of any foreign-language documents. It also mentions the need to support a declaration of renunciation of Congolese nationality.

nodes.title: Article 7
nodes.summary:
This partial document contains Articles 7, 8, and 9 from a legal text (likely an implementing decree) related to Congolese nationality law (Law 04/024 of 12 November 2004).

The main points covered are:

1.  **Article 7:** The procedural requirements and supporting documents required for an individual's application to renounce Congolese nationality. These include a legalized birth record, certificates regarding the spouse's Congolese nationality, proof of another nationality, and translations of documents.

2.  **Article 8:** The procedural requirements and supporting documents required for a Congolese person who lost their nationality (due to affiliation, descent, or legal presumption) and wishes to recover it. The list of documents is more extensive, including proof of original Congolese nationality, certificates on loss of nationality from another country, proof of habitual residence in the DRC, certificates of good conduct, a criminal record extract, and a curriculum vitae.

3.  **Article 9:** A common provision granting the Minister of Justice the discretionary power to exempt a person from producing one or several documents listed in the decree, or to require alternative documents.
